laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Potassium levels decreased to less than 5 mEq/L in 2004, then to less than 3.6 mEq/L in 2008.
Decreased to 32.0 pg/ml after parathyroidectomy in 2002. Increased again to 882 pg/ml by current admission (2011).
Improved from low levels of 2.4–2.8 mEq/L preoperatively.
Increased to 57.5 pg/ml at 12 months post-adrenalectomy and decreased to 32.8 pg/ml at 15 months.
Decreased to 2.5 µg/dl at 2 weeks after adrenalectomy, increased to 9.3 µg/dl at 15 months.
Decreased to 4.1 ng/dl at 15 months post-adrenalectomy.
Decreased to 1.4 ng/ml/h at 15 months post-adrenalectomy.
Decreased to 40 ng/ml at 15 months post-adrenalectomy.
